citation.article-title: Characterization of Bacillus brevis with descriptions of Bacillus migulanus sp. nov., Bacillus choshinensis sp. nov., Bacillus parabrevis sp. nov., and Bacillus galactophilus sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Bacillus parabrevis sp. nov.
Bacillus parabrevis (pa.ra.bre'vis. Gr. prep. para, alongside of, like; M. L. adj. brevis, short; M. L. parabrevis, brevis-like, referring to B. brevis)
Strains of this species have the common characteristics of the B. brevis group.
In addition, positive for reduction of nitrate to nitrite; utilization of ammonium; hydrolysis of casein, gelatin, DNA, and Tween 60; and acid production from D-glucose, trehalose, and D-mannitol.
Negative for acid production from D-fructose and D-galactose.
The G+C content ranges from 51.3 to 53.3 mol%; the G+C content of the type strain is 51.8 mol%.
The type strain is IFO 12334 (= ATCC 10027 = JCM 8506).
